decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy through hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also managing the board with removal spells like Path to Exile and Murderous Cut. Lingering Souls provides a constant stream of creatures and Monastery Mentor can generate even more threats. The deck also includes powerful card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently controlling the game and overwhelming them with threats.

The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly using creatures like Overgrown Battlement and Wall of Roots, as well as utilizing cards like Simian Spirit Guide. The ultimate goal is to cheat out powerful creatures like Primeval Titan, Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, and Inferno Titan using cards like Through the Breach and Summoning Trap. The deck also includes removal spells like Anger of the Gods and Beast Within to control the board while setting up the combo. The key strategy is to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to bring out big threats and overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board and stall the game until you can assemble the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Scapeshift to deal massive amounts of damage to your opponent in one turn. The deck includes various control spells like Cryptic Command and Remand to disrupt your opponent's game plan and buy you time to find your combo pieces. Once you have enough lands in play, you can use Scapeshift to fetch multiple Valakut and deal lethal damage to your opponent in a single turn.

This deck revolves around the combo of Deceiver Exarch and Splinter Twin to create an infinite amount of hasty 1/4 creatures. The deck aims to control the board through counterspells and removal until it can assemble the combo pieces and win the game in one explosive turn. The deck also utilizes versatile cards like Snapcaster Mage and Cryptic Command to outmaneuver the opponent and protect the combo. Timing and sequencing are crucial to ensure the combo goes off successfully and the opponent can't disrupt it.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Scavenging Ooze alongside disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Abrupt Decay to apply pressure on the opponent while controlling the board. The deck also includes some powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil to grind out incremental advantages and close out the game. The inclusion of cards like Lingering Souls and Batterskull provide additional value and resiliency, making it a well-rounded aggro deck with a strong midrange element.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible using low-cost spells and efficient creatures. The deck aims to control the board with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike while deploying fast and evasive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. Eidolon of the Great Revel punishes opponents for playing spells, while Boros Charm and Lightning Helix provide both burn and protection for your creatures. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they can stabilize.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by disrupting opponents with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also having removal spells like Path to Exile and Murderous Cut to deal with threats. Additionally, the deck can generate card advantage with cards like Lingering Souls and Thought Scour, and has powerful finishers in the form of Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Monastery Mentor. The deck also utilizes Snapcaster Mage to flashback spells and Remand to counter opposing spells, creating a versatile and adaptable control strategy.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite with Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker or Splinter Twin to create an infinite loop of creatures attacking or generating tokens. The deck includes disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces, along with card draw from Serum Visions. Additionally, Humble Defector can be used to draw extra cards and generate advantage. The mana base is designed to support the various colored spells needed for the combo.

This Modern Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays to deal damage to the opponent quickly and efficiently. With a combination of burn spells and efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze also helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while dealing damage. Overall, the deck's strategy is to be hyper-aggressive and apply pressure from the very beginning of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to consistently deal damage to the opponent through a combination of burn spells and aggressive creatures. By utilizing efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Searing Blaze, along with fast creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, this deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. With cards like Boros Charm and Skullcrack providing additional reach and protection, the deck aims to close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistency and speed in casting spells.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent with low-cost, highly efficient burn spells and creatures. By consistently dealing direct damage to the opponent's life total, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm and defeat the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize or mount a defense. With a focus on speed and efficiency, the deck utilizes a combination of burn spells, aggressive creatures, and land destruction to maintain pressure and prevent the opponent from gaining momentum.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively and quickly deal damage to the opponent using cheap and efficient spells and creatures. With a low curve and high aggression, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and punish them for playing spells or trying to gain life. The key strategy involves utilizing efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, along with aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, to quickly bring the opponent's life total to zero before they can stabilize.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on early disruption and removal spells like Thoughtseize and Lightning Bolt, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Tasigur, the Golden Fang to close out the game quickly. The deck aims to control the board and apply pressure to the opponent, using Liliana of the Veil and Raging Ravine to maintain board presence. The deck also includes versatile removal options like Abrupt Decay and Terminate to deal with a variety of threats, making it a strong choice for aggressive players looking to dominate the early game.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Siege Rhino to quickly pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also includes removal spells like Path to Exile and Abrupt Decay to deal with threats, along with versatile planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil for additional disruption. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's three-color strategy, allowing for consistent plays throughout the game. Overall, the deck aims to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Splinter Twin combo by using Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to untap a creature and then enchanting it with Splinter Twin to create an infinite number of hasty tokens. The deck also includes various control elements such as counterspells and removal to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, there are cards like Vendilion Clique and Snapcaster Mage to provide card advantage and flexibility in different matchups. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while also including utility lands like Tectonic Edge and Desolate Lighthouse.

This deck focuses on combining the cards Splinter Twin and either Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to create an infinite creature token combo, allowing for an immediate win. The deck also includes strong control elements, such as counterspells and removal, to protect the combo and control the game against opponents. It aims to set up the combo as quickly as possible while disrupting the opponent's game plan, leading to a swift victory.
